page.title: 14Health Centre: Pateley
page.content: The Health Centre has four doctors to cover an area from Middlesmoor to the Skipton border, across to Sawley and down to Darley. The centre also employs one nurse, a district nurse and assistant, a health visitor and assistant, two social workers, one speech therapist, one chiropodist, one physiotherapist and two receptionists. Surgeries are held every morning and evening during the week. On Thursday afternoons, there is a clinic for babies where they can be weighed and checked for development. For unwell babies, there is always a doctor on duty. The health visitor gives injections to young people for diseases such as tetanus, diphtherea, measles, polio and whooping cough. She also checks babies' hearing. She often comes to our school to check our hearing, eyes, and sometimes hair!
